block.p: Darfur Advocacy Group Undergoes a Shake-Up Even as advocacy groups attained the seeming triumph of President Bush's new sanctions against Sudan, the organization that helped bring the conflict in Darfur to the world's attention is in upheaval after criticism from relief groups. It is firing its director, reorganizing its board and rethinking its strategies.
PAGE A5

18 Dead in Lebanon Fighting After days of relative quiet, Lebanon's army moved closer to a Palestinian refugee camp in the northern part of the country, where a group of militants inspired by Al Qaeda has been hiding. The army seized new ground in a daylong battle that left 18 dead and dozens wounded.
PAGE A7
Softer U.S. Tone on China Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates struck a conciliatory tone toward Beijing two years after Donald H. Rumsfeld bluntly criticized China's military buildup.
PAGE A6

Longtime Bush Aide Departs Dan Bartlett, the White House counselor and one of President Bush's longest-serving aides, said he would leave the administration this summer. His departure is the latest from Mr. Bush's shrinking inner circle.
PAGE A10
Meeting Set on Dow Jones The Bancroft family, which controls Dow Jones & Company, will meet with News Corporation on Monday on a possible sale -- a door that family members say was always left ajar.
